alert.note: Alert for Dimmit; Edwards; Frio; Kinney; Maverick; Real; Uvalde; Val Verde; Zavala (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued March 21 at 3:17AM CDT until March 22 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS WEST OF A LINE FROM ROCKSPRINGS TO PEARSALL TODAY AND TUESDAY... .Strong winds behind a dry-line will spread east from West Texas into the parts of the Hill Country and Rio Grande Plains this afternoon. A cold front will arrive late tonight and also bring critical fire weather conditions that will continue into Tuesday. However, the strongest winds are expected in the daytime as strong winds aloft mix down to the surface. Expect winds of 15 to 30 mph with some gusts to 40 mph and afternoon humidity minimums between 10 and 20 percent. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR COUNTIES ALONG AND WEST OF A LINE FROM ROCKSPRINGS TO PEARSALL... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR COUNTIES ALONG AND WEST OF A LINE FROM ROCKSPRINGS TO PEARSALL... * WINDS...Northwest 15 to 30 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 10 percent. * IMPACTS...Any wildfires ignited may spread rapidly and unpredictably. Prevention of fire starts by avoiding planned burning, or by limiting activities prone to produce sparks can stop the start and spread of wildfires.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior. A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.

area.areaDesc: Dimmit; Edwards; Frio; Kinney; Maverick; Real; Uvalde; Val Verde; Zavala
